properties.title: Red Panda
properties.description: The red panda is slightly larger than a domestic cat with a bear-like body and thick russet fur

properties.title: Bornean Orangutan
properties.description: The Bornean orangutan differs in appearance from the Sumatran orangutan, with a broader face and shorter beard and also slightly darker in color

properties.title: Sumatran Elephant
properties.description: Sumatran elephants feed on a variety of plants and deposit seeds wherever they go, contributing to a healthy forest ecosystem

properties.title: Bonobo
properties.description: Bonobos are usually a bit smaller, leaner and darker than chimpanzees

properties.title: Narwhal
properties.description: The narwhal looks like a cross between a whale and a unicorn with its long, spiraled tusk jutting from its head

properties.title: Yangtze Finless Porpoise
properties.description: The Yangtze River, the longest river in Asia, used to be one of the only two rivers in the world that was home to two different species of dolphin—the Yangtze finless porpoise and the Baiji dolphin

properties.title: Marine Iguana
properties.description: One of the main nesting zones for iguanas is located on a central tourist beach in the waterfront area of Puerto Villamil on Isabela Island

properties.title: Great White Shark
properties.description: The great white shark is the world's largest known predatory fish. It has 300 teeth, yet does not chew its food

properties.title: Dugong
properties.description: Dugongs are cousins of manatees and share a similar plump appearance, but have a dolphin fluke-like tail

properties.title: African Wild Dog
properties.description: The largest populations remain in southern Africa and the southern part of East Africa (especially Tanzania and northern Mozambique)

properties.title: Beluga
properties.description: Belugas are extremely sociable mammals that live, hunt and migrate together in pods, ranging from a few individuals to hundreds of whales

properties.title: Polar Bear
properties.description: Polar bears are classified as marine mammals because they spend most of their lives on the sea ice of the Arctic Ocean

properties.title: Hippopotamus
properties.description: The hippopotamus, also known as the “river horse,” lives along the rivers and lakes throughout sub-Saharan Africa

properties.title: Bluefin Tuna
properties.description: Bluefin tuna are made for speed: built like torpedoes, have retractable fins and their eyes are set flush to their body

properties.title: Bigeye Tuna
properties.description: Bigeye tuna are generally smaller than bluefin and larger than yellowfin

properties.title: Sea Lions
properties.description: Sea lions haul out in large colonies on rocks and sandy shores on the Islands

properties.title: Rockhopper Penguin
properties.description: They were named for their distinctive hopping movements over the rocky hills and cliffs where they live and breed

properties.title: Malayan Tiger
properties.description: Their Latin name—Panthera tigris jacksoni—honors Peter Jackson, the famous tiger conservationist

properties.title: Blue Whale
properties.description: The blue whale is the largest animal on the planet, weighing as much as 200 tons (approximately 33 elephants)

properties.title: Hawksbill Turtle
properties.description: Hawksbills are found mainly throughout the world's tropical oceans, predominantly in coral reefs

properties.title: Black Rhino
properties.description: Black rhinos are the smaller of the two African rhino species

properties.title: Jaguar
properties.description: Jaguars are strong swimmers and climbers and require large areas of tropical rain forest and stretches of riverbank to survive

properties.title: Hunphead Wrasse
properties.description: The humphead wrasse is an enormous coral reef fish—growing over six feet long—with a prominent bulge on its forehead

properties.title: Amur Leopard
properties.description: The Amur leopard is also known as the Far East leopard, the Manchurian leopard or the Korean leopard

properties.title: Black Spider Monkey
properties.description: The black spider monkey—also known as the Guiana or red-faced spider monkey—is found in eastern South America in areas north of the Amazon River

properties.title: Vaquita
properties.description: Vaquita, the world’s most rare marine mammal, is on the edge of extinction

properties.title: Cross River Gorilla
properties.description: This subspecies of the western gorilla is very similar in appearance to the more numerous western lowland gorilla

properties.title: Plain Bisons
properties.description: Symbols of strength and determination, bison are Ice Age survivors

properties.title: Snow Leopard
properties.description: The snow leopard’s powerful build allows it to scale great steep slopes with ease

properties.title: Green Turtle
properties.description: The green turtle is one of the largest sea turtles and the only herbivore among the different species

properties.title: Saolo
properties.description: Saola (pronounced: sow-la) are recognized by two parallel horns with sharp ends, which can reach 20 inches in length

properties.title: Indian Elephant
properties.description: Indian elephants may spend up to 19 hours a day feeding and they can produce about 220 pounds of dung per day while wandering over an area that can cover up to 125 square miles
